content.question:
Stomata are pores on the surfaces of the leaves and stems of plants that regulate gas exchange between the plants and the atmosphere.

Researchers found that the stomata density on the leaves of a species of plant change as the concentration of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the atmosphere changes. When grown at 350 <math alttext="parts per million" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ppm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> the plant has an average density of 300 stomata per <math alttext="square millimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>mm</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, but when grown at 400 <math alttext="parts per million" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ppm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> the plant has an average density of 250 stomata per <math alttext="square millimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>mm</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Which of the following best describes how the ratio of the density of stomata (stomata per <math alttext="square millimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>mm</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>) per <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> concentration (<math alttext="parts per million" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ppm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>) changes as the <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> concentration increases?

choices.label: The ratio decreases from <math alttext="0.86" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.86</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="0.63" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.63</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, because fewer stomata are needed at higher <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> concentrations.

The ratio decreases from <math alttext="1.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="1.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, because fewer stomata are needed at higher <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> concentrations.

The ratio increases from <math alttext="0.63" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>0.63</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="0.86" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.86</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, because more stomata are needed at higher <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> concentrations.

The ratio increases from <math alttext="1.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="1.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, because more stomata are needed at higher <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> concentrations.

content.answer: The ratio decreases from <math alttext="0.86" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.86</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="0.63" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.63</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, because fewer stomata are needed at higher <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> concentrations.

skill.text: 5.A: Perform mathematical calculations, including: i. mathematical equations in the curriculum ii. means iii. rates iv. ratios v. percentages and percent changes
